title: Director, Program Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson College in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: 1. A screening call 2. An half-hour long interview with 3 individuals, including the hiring manager. 3. An hour-long interview with 8 individuals (4 each half hour) and the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: What are some challenges you see with working remotely?

title: First-Year Writing Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson College
Interview Descriptions: Had to write a complete semester teaching sequence then present this to the hiring committee. Had an in person interview with the committee where they asked in depth questions about teaching pedagogy and style.
Interview Questions: Walk us through your semester syllabus

title: Tech Support Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson College
Interview Descriptions: It was only one interview, you email them and they send you a time. Very easy and laid back. After that they get back to you in a few days, not bad at all
Interview Questions: They asked about past experience with studio space and scheduling

title: Usher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson College
Interview Descriptions: Great process to understand you more and ensure that you learn a ton about the role and growth potential. Asking as many thoughtful questions is appreciated. If this is your first interview, ensure that you are truly interested and not just looking for income.
Interview Questions: What do you know about theatre?

title: Desktop Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emerson College
Interview Descriptions: I did one phone and one video interview with them. In between the interviews, didn't hear anything awhile back. When it came to the last interview (the video interview), I received no follow up from the hiring manager. Really unprofessional to say the least.
Interview Questions: What do you have to bring to Emerson?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Emerson College in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Disorganized as it relates to human resources. The HR staff member that was initially supposed to contact me never did. Overall the interview with staff went well and they seem to have positive morale.
Interview Questions: What would we be surprised about 6 months down the line in the position?

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson College
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process! Everyone was very compassionate and asked careful questions that were relevant to the opportunity. Two rounds of interviews took place before I was offered the company role.
Interview Questions: Q: What makes you a good fit for this role?

title: Welcome Desk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson College
Interview Descriptions: Just a few questions to see how would you respond in certain situations. Also how you would interact on a day to day basis with residents, and people living at the residential buildings
Interview Questions: How could you help improve or benefit the resident's experience?

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson College
Interview Descriptions: The process was very fast. There was an initial phone screen, interview, and second interview. I would say from the initial application to my first day only took a month.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were situational and there was a mini exercise at the end.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson College
Interview Descriptions: process was well planned and put together, met with several people, they all knew what they were talking about and i had all my questions answered. i dont have anything else to say
Interview Questions: what would you say is your greatest strength

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Emerson College in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: zoom interview and then on-campus visit. They required one research talk and a teaching demo. In between these talks, I also had back-to-back meetings with faculty members, usually in a group of three.
Interview Questions: standard academic questions regarding research, teaching, and service

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position in September 2019. I was contacted for a phone interview in November and invited on-campus for an interview the next week. I met with the team and ran through lots of questions/scenarios for about an hour. They were very nice and I thought I did really well.  I didn't hear back on the status of the decision until the first week of January, where they informed me they decided to go with someone else. I was frustrated with how long it took, but the team was very nice to me, so I assume it was Emerson's issue and not theirs.
Interview Questions: Can you explain a time where you had to deal with a very frustrated client?

title: Alumni Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Short and easy interview, I liked the people and atmosphere and I was made to feel very comfortable. I loved getting a tour around Th e office and meeting new people. It was very welcoming and I was happy to hear back for the job so quickly.
Interview Questions: What was one problem you faced in the work environment that you had to fix and work out?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview, online with 4 professors and a student. Very well organized and personable, then campus visit, where I taught 2 classes and interviewed with faculty, staff, students, and administration.
Interview Questions: What interested you about working at Emerson?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very straightforward. Everyone was very friendly. I applied to the position in early November. I heard back in late November to set up an initial interview. Interviewed with the Advising team. Interview questions were typical and straightforward. I was told I would hear back in about a week and then I was called for a second interview. The team was so friendly and welcoming! I was told again I would hear back in about a week and I was offered the position!
Interview Questions: Have you ever refused to work with a student?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met the professor in his office and had a brief discussion of the position and what was expected. Afterwards, I was emailed about being offered the position and also received an email from Emerson's student employment office concerning paperwork necessary to begin working.
Interview Questions: What genres do you like to read?

title: Graduate Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted only a few days after I responded to the job posting for a phone screen. I was invited to interview on campus and meet the entire grad admissions team. Everyone was really nice and cordial throughout the process. They all asked really thoughtful questions and it was clear they'd read and thought about my application. The interview was relatively short but included a tour of campus with one of their student workers.
Interview Questions: What would you bring to a potluck?

title: Archivist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I first had a phone interview, which featured the search committee (4 people), and then a half day long in person interview on Emerson's campus including a presentation. There were approximately 5 sections, the presentation, a group interview, a tour, an individual interview and an interview with HR.
Interview Questions: What do you wish we had asked you?

title: House Usher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy to follow. It was based on customer service experience and explaining your flexibility. It was a group interview where you get to interact with each other and learn about what is expected from the position.
Interview Questions: What was you availability?

title: Membership Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for a position at Emerson College's radio station WERS. I was called for a phone interview, then a one on one with my would be boss and finally a panel interview. Never encountered any technical questions, all of them we're asked just to get to know me and my experiences more. Felt like they were more or less just trying to get a good feel for me rather than testing my knowledge. Everyone was very polite and cordial, from the GM all the way down to the student interns it was just a pleasure interacting with everyone.
Interview Questions:
Can you work autonomously and make a project your own?
Can you delegate and work with students?
What are some of the ideas you have to boost membership?
What was a time you and someone you worked with had a disagreement and how did you resolve it?
The day to day work is very inconstant here, is that something you can handle?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Emerson College
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by one of the leading professors in the marketing and communications department. The interview was more like a conversation about what things I enjoy to do, what is my passion, why I chose to study marketing and advertising.
Interview Questions: What kind of boss do you prefer?

title: Darkroom Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone, casual, conversational. I spoke with the darkroom manager about the duties of being a monitor and past experience that could have prepared me for this position. She asked me questions about my interest in being a monitor and my past photography classes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a monitor?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I stared by applying through the student employment office, and then was contacted by the director of the office. We had a 45 minute interview where we focused on the kind of nonprofit work I had done and how I would integrate that into marketing work for the office, as well as how confident I was in managing staff writers, I was then I was hired a week later
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in service learning?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emerson College
Interview Descriptions: Very brief phone interview, followed by a Skype interview, followed by an in-person interview on campus in Boston. Was hired almost immediately following the third interview. The accommodations were great and impressions made by the faculty were very positive. They seem to be as interested in personal values as they are with industry experience and academic acumen.
Interview Questions: What do you think is the future of the industry and what direction is it going?

title: Phonathon Calelr Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone interview process after I applied online. Set up a time to talk on the phone and spoke for about 10 minutes with a supervisor and the boss.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that a situation did not go the way you wanted it to go

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process was quick and included a phone screening followed by a long day of back to back interviews. I met with some people one on one and some people in a group setting. Everyone was very friendly and easy going but it was a bit tiring to meet with so many people (maybe 7-8?) in a row and answer the same types of questions over and over again.
Interview Questions: Why did Emerson seem like a good fit for me?

title: IT Helpdesk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the helpdesk position at the IT department at Emerson College. I was staying for a summer session and wanted a side job. Pretty standard interview process; first sent my resume & cover letter, then had a one on one with the User Services Coordinator, Carlin Corrigan. Very nice person. We had a great talk, went over my technological experience and knowledge, and she reassured me I'd learn more through training.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience using the Slack app?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process is in three parts: the application and resume, the group process, and the interview. The most unusual part is the group process. In it, the applicants were put in teams and asked to perform certain tasks such as create a cheer or a program and interviewees looked to see how well the applicants could work as a team.
Interview Questions:
What does diversity mean to you? 
How will you build a sense of community?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: you have to write four essays with one of them being a powerpoint presentation about yourslef to present yourslef in a way different than the essays you wrote. You also have to take the GMAT and have a minimum score that would allow you to apply
Interview Questions: why do you think this program is a good fit for you

title: JPC Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great - very quick and efficient. I applied online and received an email asking me to come in to interview within the next few days. The interview was great in that I also got a tour of the Journalism Production Center. I felt very comfortable and confident throughout the interview, and got a great sense of what it would be like to work in the JPC.
Interview Questions: Tell Me About Yourself.

title: Assistant Director of Enrollment Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emerson College (Boston, MA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: The initial phone screening was very rushed and not as thorough as I would have expected. I went in for two in person interviews, the first with immediate staff, the second with additional people I would be working with.  Both interviews were also rushed and no one seemed prepared to have me there even though they scheduled it.
Interview Questions: What types of project management experience have you had?
